title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1211.7 - Inspection of vehicle load
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1211.7 - Inspection of vehicle load

State Regulations
(a) The
presence in a tunnel, upon the George Washington Bridge Lower Level or George

Washington Bridge Expressway of a vehicle loaded with any dangerous article, or
a tank vehicle which last contained a dangerous article, is likely to endanger
persons or property and render the use of said facilities unsafe. Therefore, no
such vehicle or tank vehicle shall be allowed in or upon said facilities unless
it shall conform to the rules and regulations set forth in this Part in
addition to all other rules and regulations established for the use of these
facilities. (b) Any vehicle whose
load includes or is believed by a Port Authority police officer to include any
dangerous article shall be subject to inspection prior to entering either a
tunnel, the George Washington Bridge Lower Level or George Washington Bridge

Expressway, in order to determine whether such entry would be in violation of
the rules and regulations set forth in this Part. (c) No vehicle loaded with a dangerous
article shall enter said facilities unless the driver shall first, on demand
made by a Port Authority police officer, exhibit a bill of lading or other
shipping paper describing such article by the specific name by which it is
known in the "List of Exposives and Other Dangerous Articles" contained in Part
172 of the D.O.T. regulations or as required by this Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1211.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
